full_threads.body:
Hi Michelle, 

Sure, confirming the updates have been made: https://readytoread.com.au/on-demand/

Hi Heath

Based on feedback and testing, we’d like to make some changes to which FAQs are shown on the On-Demand home page; as well as some general edits.

Could you please make the following updates to the FAQs:

Change the four visible questions to:
How do I subscribe? <Note: This is a new FAQ, copy is below>
I didn’t receive all three emails after I subscribed. What do I do? <Note: This is a new FAQ, copy is below>
How does this program differ from Ready to Read classes?
How is Ready to Read On-Demand different to other online programs?

Add this Q/A:
How do I subscribe?
The ‘click for instant access’ buttons on this page allow you to start the subscription process. From there, complete the information to finalise your subscription.
Click here <https://youtu.be/p3z3Q6ADAD0> to watch a video which demonstrates how to complete the subscription process.

Add this Q/A:
I didn’t receive all three emails after I subscribed. What do I do?
After completing your subscription, you should receive the following three emails:
Your receipt
Your user name and password details
A welcome email, detailing how to get the most out of the program
If you don’t receive all three emails, please check your spam/junk folder, right-click on the email and select ‘not junk’. This will prevent our fortnightly literacy tips from ending up in the same folder!

Change this Q/A:
How do I view each lesson?
You can use either your computer, tablet, smart TV or smartphone to watch a lesson on any browser, using your unique login. Lessons, videos or audio files cannot be downloaded/saved, as copyright restrictions apply.
To:
How do I view the lessons?
You can use either your computer, tablet, smart TV or smartphone to watch a lesson on any browser, using your unique login. Lessons, videos or audio files cannot be downloaded/saved, as copyright restrictions apply. Your welcome email will include a video which demonstrates how to access and navigate the lesson menu.

Change this Q/A:

How is Ready to Read On-Demand different to other online programs?

Ready to Read On-Demand is an Australian, non-animated, online early literacy program.

Firstly, a great deal of educational content found online is non-Australian, at times resulting in children picking up different accents, vocabulary and methods of pronunciation. The Ready to Read teacher featured in this program speaks with a fluent Australian accent and encourages the use of Australian terminology.

Secondly, children are exposed to a wide range of animated games and programs, featuring computerised voices. Our program is taught by a real teacher, using her real voice, as if the child is in a classroom environment.

Finally, our program encourages the development of the dynamic tripod pencil grip; and our downloads give children the opportunity to practise writing and letter formation, in preparation for school.

To:

How is Ready to Read On-Demand different to other online programs?

Ready to Read On-Demand is an Australian, non-animated, online early literacy program. Here are a few features which make our program unique:

A great deal of educational content found online is non-Australian, at times resulting in children picking up different accents, vocabulary and methods of pronunciation. The Ready to Read teacher featured in this program speaks with a fluent Australian accent and encourages the use of Australian terminology.
Children are exposed to a wide range of animated games and programs, featuring computerised voices. Our program is taught by a real teacher, using her real voice, as if the child is in a classroom environment.
Our program encourages the development of the dynamic tripod pencil grip; and our downloads give children the opportunity to practise writing and letter formation, as guided by our teacher, in preparation for school.
Fortnightly literacy tips are emailed to parents, allowing them to develop their child’s early literacy skills at home.

In the Q/A:
How does this program differ from Ready to Read classes?

In the first paragraph, change:
available in limited locations.
to
available in selected locations <http://www.readytoread.com.au/locations>.

In the Q/A:
Who can take part?

Change the final point to:
Children who are currently enrolled in Ready to Read classes, in order to consolidate learning through the week (complimentary access to Ready to Read On-Demand is included with Ready to Read class enrolment).

Change the title of this Q:
Is this different to what they will learn at pre-school or school?
To:
Is this different to what my child will learn at pre-school or school?

In the Q/A:
What personal information will you keep about me?
Remove the final sentence: We will not keep credit card details on file.

In the Q/A:
How do I get the most out of this program?
The final point should be in the same format as the other points.

In the Q/A:
Can I share my subscription with a friend?
Change:
without the permission
to:
without permission

In the Q/A:
Can I use my subscription in a commercial, preschool day care or school setting?
Change heading to:
Can I use my subscription in a commercial, preschool, day care, or school setting?
Also link the text ‘Ready to Read head office’ to email support@readytoread.com.au <mailto:support@readytoread.com.au>

Many thanks
Michelle

<http://readytoread.com.au/>
Michelle Mowbray
Director, Marketing & Engagement
P: 0403 258 215 <tel:0403%20258%20215> | E: michelle@readytoread.com.au <mailto:michelle@readytoread.com.au> | W: readytoread.com.au <http://readytoread.com.au/>
Building the foundation for a lifetime of learning
